value:
<add xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" place="margin">
            <l>24</l>
          </add>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">28</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">If we try to look at them, off the stage, in their real</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">persons <add hand="ms" place="above">private lives</add>, we see only wisps; passing phantoms. There are the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Fytton sisters, daughters of <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-efyt" key="Fytton, Edward">Sir Edward Fytton</rs>, knight of <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-gaws" key="Gawsworth">Gawsworth</rs> in <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-ches" key="Cheshire">Cheshire</rs>. <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-mfyt" key="Fytton, Mary">Mary</rs>, the younger,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">became one of <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-eliz" key="Elizabeth I">Elizabeths</rs> Maids of Honour. She goes</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">from her country hometo the great world. <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-wkno" key="Knollys, William">Sir William Knollys</rs>,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">xmxmxmmxmx a person of great consequence there, promised her</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">father that he will not fail <quote source="#" rend="inline">to fulfil your desire in 
            <choice>
              <sic>playig</sic>
              <corr>playing</corr>
            </choice></quote></l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="inline">
            <l>the Good shepherd and will to my power defend the innocent</l>
            <l>lamb 
              <choice>
                <sic>fro</sic>
                <corr>from</corr>
              </choice> the wolvish 
              <choice>
                <sic>crulety</sic>
                <corr>cruelty</corr>
              </choice> and foxlike subtlety</l>
          </quote>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">of the tame 
            <choice>
              <sic>beats</sic>
              <corr>beasts</corr>
            </choice> of this 
            <choice>
              <sic>vplace</sic>
              <corr>place</corr>
            </choice>..."</quote> His words 
            <choice>
              <sic>weve</sic>
              <corr>weave</corr>
            </choice> a veil</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">through which nothing is seen in its actual shape. <add hand="ms" place="above">some horror is concealed [behind?] the flowers</add>. There is</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">silence. Then 
            <choice>
              <sic>Sile ce</sic>
              <corr>Silence</corr>
            </choice> falls. Then in involved 
            <choice>
              <sic>mata hors</sic>
              <corr>metaphors</corr>
            </choice>,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">making use of the old images, speaking 
            <choice>
              <sic>circumlocuitouly</sic>
              <corr>circumlocutiously</corr>
            </choice> of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">spring and summer and winter frost and flowers in a fair</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">garden he reveals obliquely his illicit passion for the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">girl. 
            <choice>
              <sic>Sile ce</sic>
              <corr>Silence</corr>
            </choice> again 
            <choice>
              <sic>decends</sic>
              <corr>descends</corr>
            </choice>. Then <quote source="#" rend="inline">"one Mrs Martin who</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote>dwelt at the <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml/pla-chop" key="Chopping Knife">Chopping Knife near Ludgate"</rs></quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">gossips that the Maid of Honour has dressed up <add hand="typewriter" place="above">as a man</add></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">in a <add hand="typewriter" place="above">large</add> great white cloak and gone to meet her lover Lord</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-wpem" key="Pembroke, William">Pembroke</rs> privately. Silence again descends. Then</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Mary has borne him a bastard, whom he refuses to acknowledge.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">And her father conveys her home. 
            <choice>
              <sic>Sielnce</sic>
              <corr>Silence</corr>
            </choice> again 
            <choice>
              <sic>decsneds</sic>
              <corr>descends</corr>
            </choice>.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It is broken later when some further intrigue makes her</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">mother cry: <quote source="#" rend="inline">If it had pleased God when I did bear her</quote></l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="inline">
            <l>that she and I had been buried it had saved me from a great</l>
            <l>deal of sorrow and grief and her from...such shame as never</l>
            <l>had Cheshire woman..... Write no more to me of her."</l>
          </quote>
